thing. To start with, it can save money for teachers and schools. As time passes, the price value

teachers need to give students extra treats, they will have a lot of extra spending on buying those
treats, which might let teachers have a negative impression on teaching. In this way, the teacher's
teaching quality might decrease, and have a negative impact on students' academic performance.
Also, when students need extra play time, the number of teachers might not be enough so the
school needs to hire extra teachers, which will be another expense. In contrast, giving students
interesting and hands-on activities doesn't cost extra money, and schools can save those
spending on more valuable approaches. 144words

The Most Important Factor for Employer t.raw_ocr_text:
From my perspective, the most important factor for employers to consider when deciding where
employees should work is the time cost. The main reason is that time determines profits. When
office is too far from employees' home, they may have to spend hours on commuting, which
means they may have to get up quite early if employers requires them to reach the company, and
that is an obviously unreasonable option. under that situation and considering the time cost,
employers would find that allowing employees to work at home would enable companies to
produce more each day because employees receive more rest by saving the time spent on
traveling long distance to the company, prompting their working efficiency. In this way, the whole

company could be more productive, increasing the profit. |130words
